header.title: Claude Code Guide
header.subtitle: Just 6 easy steps to start your AI coding journey

intro.title: Before We Begin
intro.subtitle: Let's make sure you have everything ready. Don't worry, we'll guide you through each step!

requirements.claudePro: Claude Pro Account - You'll need the Pro plan ($20/month)
requirements.time: About 20-30 minutes - Take your time, there's no rush!
requirements.internet: Internet Connection - Just like you're using now

mac.title: Getting to Know Terminal
mac.description: Terminal is like texting with your computer - you type commands and it responds. Don't worry, it's easier than it looks!
mac.howToOpen: Let's open Terminal (it's already on your Mac!)
mac.methods: Press <kbd>Command (Cmd) ⌘</kbd> + <kbd>Space</kbd> and type "terminal";Go to Applications → Utilities → Terminal;Search "terminal" in Launchpad

windows.title: Getting to Know Command Prompt
windows.description: Command Prompt is like texting with your computer - you type commands and it responds. It might look intimidating, but you'll get the hang of it!
windows.howToOpen: Let's open Command Prompt (it's already on your PC!)
windows.methods: Press <kbd>Windows</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>, type "cmd" and hit <kbd>Enter ↵</kbd>;Search for "Command Prompt" or "cmd" in Start menu;Start menu → Windows System → Command Prompt

terminalExample.mac: Great! This is Terminal - your new command center
terminalExample.windows: Perfect! This is Command Prompt - your new command center

closeTerminal.mac: How to close Terminal when you're done
closeTerminal.windows: How to close Command Prompt when you're done

closeMethods.mac: Command (Cmd) ⌘ + Q to quit completely;Command (Cmd) ⌘ + W to close just this window;Type exit and press Enter ↵
closeMethods.windows: Click the X button in the top-right corner;Type exit and press Enter ↵

intro.confirmPrompt: Ready to move on? Click below when you've opened Terminal/Command Prompt:

successButton.title: I've got Terminal open! ✓
successButton.windows: Command Prompt is open and ready

homebrew.title: Install Homebrew
homebrew.description: Think of Homebrew as the App Store for your Terminal - it makes installing developer tools super easy!
homebrew.preCodeText: Let's install Homebrew. Copy this entire line:
homebrew.postCodeText: 💡 Heads up: Your Mac will ask for your password. Type it and press Enter (you won't see it as you type - that's normal for security!)
homebrew.verifyText: Great! Let's make sure Homebrew installed correctly:

git-windows.title: Install Git for Windows
git-windows.description: Git for Windows gives your PC superpowers - it's what lets us install Claude Code and other developer tools!
git-windows.preCodeText: Click the link below to download Git for Windows:
git-windows.postCodeText: 💡 Pro tip: During installation, just keep clicking "Next" - the default options are perfect!
git-windows.verifyText: Awesome! Now let's check if Git installed properly (open a new Command Prompt first):

node.title: Install Node.js
node.description: Node.js is what makes Claude Code run - it's like the engine in a car!
node.preCodeText: Now let's install Node.js. Copy and paste this:
node.postCodeText: 💡 This might take a minute or two. You'll see "Downloading..." - that's perfectly normal!
node.verifyText: Nice work! Let's verify Node.js is ready:

node-windows.title: Install Node.js
node-windows.description: Node.js is what makes Claude Code run - it's like the engine in a car!
node-windows.preCodeText: Click below to download Node.js (we want the LTS version):
node-windows.postCodeText: 💡 During setup: Choose "LTS" (Long Term Support) and keep clicking "Next" - the defaults are perfect!
node-windows.verifyText: Excellent! Let's check if Node.js is ready (open a new Command Prompt first):

claude.title: Install Claude Code
claude.description: This is the moment we've been waiting for - let's install Claude Code itself!
claude.preCodeText: Almost there! Copy and run this command:
claude.postCodeText: 💡 This takes about 2-3 minutes. You'll see lots of text scrolling by - that's normal!
claude.verifyText: Fantastic! Let's confirm Claude Code is installed:

claude-windows.title: Install Claude Code
claude-windows.description: This is it - let's install Claude Code and start your AI coding journey!
claude-windows.preCodeText: We're almost done! Copy and run this command:
claude-windows.postCodeText: 💡 Don't worry if you see some warning messages - they're totally normal and safe to ignore!
claude-windows.verifyText: Wonderful! Let's make sure Claude Code is ready:

auth.description: Time to connect Claude Code to your Claude Pro account!
auth.preCodeText: Let's link your account. Run this:
auth.postCodeText: 💡 Your browser will pop up with a login page - just sign in with your Claude Pro account!
auth.verifyText: Perfect! Let's check if you're connected:

auth-windows.title: Connect Your Account
auth-windows.description: Time to connect Claude Code to your Claude Pro account!
auth-windows.preCodeText: Let's link your account. Run this:
auth-windows.postCodeText: 💡 Your browser will pop up with a login page - just sign in with your Claude Pro account!

summaries.start: Terminal basics mastered • Ready to install! 🚀
summaries.start-windows: Command Prompt basics mastered • Ready to install! 🚀
summaries.project: You're all set! Time to build amazing things! 🎊
summaries.project-windows: You're all set! Time to build amazing things! 🎊

createSection.title: Create Your First Project Folder
createSection.description: Let's make a home for your first AI-powered project:
createSection.tip: 💡 Name it anything you want! Popular choices: my-awesome-app, hello-claude, test-project

startSection.title: Start Claude Code
startSection.description: Here we go - let's launch Claude Code in your new project folder:
startSection.securityNote: Quick note: The first time you run Claude Code, it'll ask for permission (just like installing an app). Type <kbd>1</kbd> and press <kbd>Enter</kbd> to proceed:

resultSection.question: How did it go? Is Claude Code running?

project.title: Start Claude Code
project.description: This is it - the moment you've been waiting for! Let's create your first project and see Claude Code in action!
project.preCodeText: Let's create a project folder and fire up Claude Code:
project.securityPrompt: First time only: Claude Code will ask for permission. Just type 1 and press Enter - it's like accepting terms & conditions!
project.postCodeText: 💡 When you see the security prompt, type 1 and hit Enter. Then... welcome to your AI coding journey! 🎉

completion.title: Congratulations! 🎉
completion.subtitle: You did it! Claude Code is installed and ready to help you build amazing things!
completion.instruction: Ready to start? Just type claude in your terminal and ask it to build something - even something simple like "create a to-do list app"!

feedback.question: How was your installation experience?
feedback.reason: 💡 If this guide helped you, we'd love to hear it! Click 'Amazing!' below

titles.love: That's wonderful to hear! Any specific feedback?
titles.sad: Oh no! Please tell us what went wrong

subtitles.sad: How can we make this better?

common.title: Let's Fix This Together
common.description: Don't worry - this happens sometimes! Try these solutions:

macTypeSelector.title: First, which type of Mac do you have?

resolutions.claude: Claude Code has been successfully installed
resolutions.project: Claude Code has been successfully started
resolutions.git-windows: Git for Windows has been successfully installed
resolutions.claude-windows: Claude Code has been successfully installed
resolutions.project-windows: Claude Code has been successfully started

appleSilicon.title: For Apple Silicon Macs:
appleSilicon.instruction: Let's fix this step by step. Copy and run these commands one at a time:
appleSilicon.step1: 1. First, let's save the PATH setting:
appleSilicon.step2: 2. Now activate it for this terminal:

intel.title: For Intel Macs:
intel.instruction: No problem! Copy and run these commands one at a time:

node.title: Let's get Node.js working:
node.step2: 2. If nothing shows up, install it:
node.step3: 3. If it's already there, let's reinstall:
node.step4: 4. Sometimes it's just a PATH issue. Try this:
node.step5: 5. Still not working? Close Terminal completely and open a fresh one.

claude.title: Let's fix Claude Code:
claude.step2: 2. Let's find where npm installs things:
claude.step3: 3. Now add that location to your PATH:
claude.step5: 5. Final step: Close Terminal completely and open a new one.

claudeWindows.title: Let's get Claude Code working:
claudeWindows.step1: 1. First, let's check if it's installed:
claudeWindows.step2: 2. Not there? Let's install it again:
claudeWindows.step3Description: Right-click Command Prompt and choose "Run as administrator", then install again.
claudeWindows.step4Description: Save your work, restart your computer, and try the command again.

auth.browserNotOpenDesc: No problem! Just copy the URL from your terminal and paste it in any browser.
auth.loginNotCompleteStep1: 1. Let's log out and try fresh:
auth.loginNotCompleteStep2: 2. Still stuck? Clear your browser cookies for claude.ai and try again.
auth.accountIssueDesc: Make sure you can log into Claude normally at claude.ai

project.permissionDesc: This just means we need to start somewhere else. Try your home folder:
project.permissionNote: 💡 Your home folder is always safe to use - it's your personal space!
project.connectCheck3Mac: Restart Terminal - Sometimes a fresh start helps
project.connectCheck3Windows: Restart Command Prompt - Close window and reopen
project.stillNotWorkStep3Mac: Reopen Terminal and run the command below
project.stillNotWorkStep3Windows: Reopen Command Prompt and run the command below

nodeWindows.title: If Node.js is not recognized:
nodeWindows.step1Description: Close all Command Prompt windows and open a new one.
nodeWindows.step2Description: Restart your computer. Environment variables may need a restart to take effect after Node.js installation.
nodeWindows.step3Title: 3. If it still doesn't work after restart:
nodeWindows.step3Description: Run the Node.js installer again and make sure the "Automatically install the necessary tools" option is selected during installation.

gitWindows.title: Troubleshooting
gitWindows.step1Title: If git is not found even after restarting Command Prompt:
gitWindows.step1_2: Step 2: Search for "Command Prompt" in Start menu and run it again
gitWindows.step2Title: If it still doesn't work, restart your computer:
gitWindows.step2Description: Installation was successful but environment variables were not applied. Restarting your computer will fix this.
gitWindows.step3Title: If it still doesn't work after restart:
gitWindows.step3Description: Run the Git installer again and make sure the "Git from the command line and also from 3rd-party software" option is selected during installation.
